intro: Lantana eitenorum, commonly known as the Eiten's lantana, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, showy inflorescences that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite and usually have a rough texture, while its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Lantana eitenorum is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a common sight in tropical and subtropical environments.
